description.narrative: The project is being proposed as part of the Africa MSME Finance Program and consists in providing Interbank Burundi (IBB or Interbank) a subordinated loan of up to $5 million combined with a two-year on-site advisory services package, which will be led by a pre-selected consulting firm with a proven track record in the field of micro and SME finance advisory services. The objective of the project is to provide Interbank with longer term funding and to transfer skills and know-how so as to enable it to develop its MSME portfolio on a sustainable basis.

The project, as part of the AMSME program, will strengthen Interbanks funding base and through the transfer of expertise and best practice, will enable the bank to develop a strong capacity to grow its MSME portfolio. The project will improve credit availability to MSMEs, resulting in an increase in number and volume of loans and thereby contribute to the development and strengthening of the banking sector.
